means: 看似诱人实则令人讨厌的事物

sentence.Network_en: He does not regard his new job as a poisoned chalice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他并不认为自己的新工作是金杯毒酒。

sentence.Network_en: He inherited a poisoned chalice when he took over the job as union leader.
sentence.Network_cn: 他接手工会领导职务,看似风光,实则会给他带来很多麻烦.

sentence.Network_en: Some people even claimed that he appointed his political rival only in the belief that he was giving him a poisoned chalice and that he would not last more than a year.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人甚至说，他之所以任命自己的政治对手，是因为他知道所给的职位是杯诱人的毒酒，接受者肯定撑不过一年。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin calix, calic- 'cup'

entry.tran: (基督教圣餐礼上所用的)圣餐杯，圣杯
entry.def: A chalice is a large gold or silver cup with a stem. Chalices are used to hold wine in the Christian service of Holy Communion.

entry.tran: 金杯毒酒(指看似诱人、实则只会导致失败的工作或机会)
entry.def: If you refer to a job or an opportunity as a poisoned chalice, you mean that it seems to be very attractive but you believe it will lead to failure.

example.ex: He does not regard his new job as a poisoned chalice...
example.tran: 他并不认为自己的新工作是金杯毒酒。

example.ex: Some people even claimed that he appointed his political rival only in the belief that he was giving him a poisoned chalice and that he would not last more than a year.
example.tran: 有人甚至说，他之所以任命自己的政治对手，是因为他知道所给的职位是杯诱人的毒酒，接受者肯定撑不过一年。

means.word_mean: 1. a bowl-shaped drinking vessel; especially the Eucharistic cup
